decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through a combination of powerful planeswalkers and removal spells. By utilizing Fires of Invention, the player can cast multiple spells in a turn without worrying about mana limitations. Agent of Treachery allows for stealing key cards from the opponent, while Shark Typhoon provides a constant stream of threats. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra triggers. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent until victory is secured.

The main goal of this deck is to maintain control of the board by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and gaining card advantage. Utilizing powerful planeswalkers and enchantments, along with counterspells and removal spells, the deck aims to control the game's tempo and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides additional value and card advantage by flickering permanents on the battlefield. By generating card advantage and maintaining control of the game, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the board by using cards that disrupt the opponent's plays and generate value over time. It utilizes Fires of Invention to play multiple spells in a turn and take advantage of powerful enchantments like Elspeth Conquers Death and Omen of the Sea. The deck also includes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to provide additional value and card advantage. With a mix of removal spells, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures onto the battlefield and using Winota, Joiner of Forces to cheat out powerful creatures like Agent of Treachery and Legion Warboss. By spamming the board with tokens and cheap creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and utility. Cards like Neoform and Gilded Goose provide additional value and acceleration, while Charming Prince and Alirios, Enraptured offer flexibility and card advantage. The deck's goal is to establish a dominant board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The key concept of this deck revolves around using a companion card, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, as a critical addition to the main deck strategy. The deck focuses on powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler, Nicol Bolas, Dragon-God, and Narset, Parter of Veils, supported by removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Agonizing Remorse. The goal is to control the board and outvalue the opponent with an array of versatile spells and creatures, while leveraging the tribal synergy provided by Kaheera to gain an advantage in the match.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and casting powerful creatures and spells for free using Fires of Invention. It includes a mix of aggressive creatures like Questing Beast and Embercleave, as well as resilient threats like Cavalier of Flame and Quartzwood Crasher. The deck also utilizes the companion Kaheera to provide additional value. Overall, the goal is to establish board control early and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient threats and removal spells.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to play powerful threats such as Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with Thought Erasure and Casualties of War, while controlling the board with Extinction Event and Eat to Extinction. The deck can also utilize Unmoored Ego to remove key cards from the opponent's deck. Overall, the strategy revolves around ramping up and controlling the game until the big threats can take over.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage with a strong emphasis on board wipes to keep the opponent's threats at bay. It aims to establish a stable board presence with planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset while generating value through cards like Shark Typhoon and Omen of the Sea. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents like Omen of the Sea and Castle Ardenvale. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

This deck utilizes a blend of aggressive creatures and spells that focus on cycling to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a high volume of creatures and damage spells. The key strategy involves cycling through cards to trigger abilities such as Zenith Flare and Valiant Rescuer, while benefiting from the damage potential of Drannith Stinger and Flourishing Fox. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional synergy and consistency to the deck's overall game plan. The goal is to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

The strategy of this deck revolves around utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with removal and card advantage. Yorion, Sky Nomad is included as a companion to provide additional value and synergy with the deck's abundance of permanents. The aim is to stall the game with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils until the player can take over with powerful threats like Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast and Agent of Treachery, eventually overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and board presence.

This aggro deck focuses on utilizing a mixture of enchantments and creatures to quickly build up a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. By combining cheap enchantments with creatures that benefit from them like All That Glitters and Season of Growth, the deck aims to consistently pump out threats and take control of the game early on. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and value to the deck, allowing for constant recursion of valuable enchantments and creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing various instant and sorcery spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategies. It also includes a range of creatures with flash and disruptive abilities to protect your life total and maintain tempo. The key strategy is to use Lutri, the Spellchaser as a companion to double up on key spells and create overwhelming advantages in card advantage and tempo. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent by efficiently using its resources and leveraging the flexibility of instants and flash creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Companion ability of Lurrus of the Dream-Den to continuously bring cheap permanents back from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cheap, efficient creatures along with powerful enchantments like All That Glitters, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and protect its key creatures with protection spells like Gods Willing and Karametra's Blessing. The combination of evasion, protection, and recursion makes this deck difficult to deal with for many opponents.
